etymologies: mid 17th century: from Chinese rénshēn, from rén ‘man’ + shēn, a kind of herb (because of the supposed resemblance of the forked root to a person)

definitions: a plant tuber credited with various tonic and medicinal properties, especially in East Asia.
shortDefinitions: plant tuber credited with various tonic and medicinal properties

definitions: the plant from which ginseng is obtained, native to eastern Asia and North America.

notes.text: Genus Panax, family Araliaceae: several species, in particular the Asian P. pseudoginseng and the North American P. quinquefolius

shortDefinitions: plant from which this tuber is obtained, native to eastern Asia and North America
